div.p: Schematic view of the Gulf Stream system surface currents. Thin white lines represent annually averaged positions of the Gulf Stream path. The meandering red ribbon represents a snapshot of the Gulf Stream jet and its extension. Red and blue circles represent the warm and cold Gulf Stream rings; AzC means the Azores Current; NAC—the North Atlantic Current; GS Extension—the Gulf Stream Extension. The thick gray ribbon depicts the multi-decadal average position of the Gulf Stream path.
